sentence.Network_en: She has a knack of landing herself right in the soup.
sentence.Network_cn: 她老是让自己的处境很尴尬。

sentence.Network_en: "I have a knack for making friends, you know," she added meaningfully.
sentence.Network_cn: “你知道，我交朋友有一套的，”她故意补充说。

sentence.Network_en: It's easy, once you've got the knack.
sentence.Network_cn: 你一旦掌握这个技能就容易了。

list.abs: and then , there are those who need a smack ; for flowery words they have a knack .然后，还有那些需要一个华丽的词语之嫌的人，他们有一个诀窍。
after why has eaten tricolor , cannot roll the distant point ? what knack has ? is how practices Q tricolor practices completely 1 ?为什么吃了三色后就不能滚得远点？是不是有什么诀窍？是把Q练满还是三色练1还是怎么？
if your partner has a strange knack of being able to pick out all the right perfumes , this may not be a good sign at all .如果你的配偶掌握技巧，能够选择所有你喜欢的香水，这应该不是一个好迹象。
词组 have skill in 在…方面有技能辨析 skill knackknack 技巧, 诀窍一般只使用单数形式

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally denoting a clever or deceitful trick): probably related to obsolete knack 'sharp blow or sound', of imitative origin (compare with Dutch knak 'crack, snap')

entry.def: A knack is a particularly clever or skilful way of doing something successfully, especially something which most people find difficult.

example.ex: He's got the knack of getting people to listen.

means.word_mean: 1. a special way of doing something;

sentences.sentence: "he had a special knack for getting into trouble"
"he couldn't get the hang of it"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The market has a knack for making things cost-effective.

auth_sentence.content: Sebastian Vettel clearly has not lost the knack.

sentences.en: He's got a real knack for making money.

sentences.en: She has the unfortunate knack of always saying the wrong thing.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是，她总是说错话。
